docs.snippet: Quality vs. hype. Our visitor was troubled. He'd watched an Edwin Newman television special several nights before and wondered how seriously to take its picture of book publishing as a world where hype is king, where all efforts are concentrated o...
docs.lead_paragraph: Quality vs. hype. Our visitor was troubled. He'd watched an Edwin Newman television special several nights before and wondered how seriously to take its picture of book publishing as a world where hype is king, where all efforts are concentrated on turning certain books, regardless of their merits, into "blockbuster best sellers."

docs.snippet: THE MIGHTY GENTS," which was called "The last Street Play" when it was done at the Manhattan Theater Club, will come into the Ambassador  Theater on April 13. Briefly, it is about a group of young men, hanging out on a street corner in Newark, who...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE MIGHTY GENTS," which was called "The last Street Play" when it was done at the Manhattan Theater Club, will come into the Ambassador Theater on April 13. Briefly, it is about a group of young men, hanging out on a street corner in Newark, who realize that they were happiest when they were members of a street gang called the Mighty Gents.

headline.main: Broadway; A street gang is heading for the Ambassador.

docs.snippet: Leo Genn, the British lawyer turned actor who became known as "the man with the black velvet voice" in a stage and screen career that spanned almost four decades, died yesterday at a London hospital. He was 72 years old....
docs.lead_paragraph: Leo Genn, the British lawyer turned actor who became known as "the man with the black velvet voice" in a stage and screen career that spanned almost four decades, died yesterday at a London hospital. He was 72 years old.

headline.main: Leo Genn, British Actor, 72, Dies; 'Man With the Black Velvet Voice'; An Oscar Nomination A String of Successes

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 25--Argentina repudiated today an international arbitration decision awarding three disputed islands to Chile, but, according to military sources here, it will not press its claims by armed force....
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Jan. 25--Argentina repudiated today an international arbitration decision awarding three disputed islands to Chile, but, according to military sources here, it will not press its claims by armed force.
docs.abstract: Argentina repudiates internatl arbitration decision awarding 3 disputed islands to Chile, but will not press its claims by armed force; decision was issued May 2 and is due to go into effect next wk; Argentine decision to reject ruling is drastic move under internatl law, since both Argentina and Chile agreed to accept it; Foreign Min Vice Adm Oscar Montes announces rejection, TV address; map (M)

headline.main: ARGENTINA REJECTS RULING ON 3 ISLANDS; It Repudiates Award to Chile but Plans No Military Action

byline.original: By JUAN de ONIS Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: RICH GOSSAGE, the New York Yankees' new relief pitcher, will earn $333,000 in salary this season, $1,000 more than  Reggie Jackson, Gossage, who earned $46,800 with Pittsburgh last year, also received the largest signing bonus, $750,000, of any of...
docs.lead_paragraph: RICH GOSSAGE, the New York Yankees' new relief pitcher, will earn $333,000 in salary this season, $1,000 more than Reggie Jackson, Gossage, who earned $46,800 with Pittsburgh last year, also received the largest signing bonus, $750,000, of any of baseball's second group of free agents.
docs.abstract: Article examines contracts of 14 baseball free-agents who have been signed since end of '77 season; chart (M)

headline.main: The Free Agents: Exactly Who Got What
